snippet: In a survey, more than half of those asked said they had not bothered to figure out how much they’d need to retire, and only 14 percent said they were very confident they’d have enough.
abstract: Survey conducted by the Employee Benefit Research Institute shows that more than half of those asked said they had not bothered to figure out how much they would need to retire, and only 14 percent said they were very confident they would have enough.
lead_paragraph: In a survey, more than half of those asked said they had not bothered to figure out how much they’d need to retire, and only 14 percent said they were very confident they’d have enough.

headline.seo: Calculating Your Readiness to Retire, Financially and Otherwise
headline.main: Making Sure Money’s Still There When It’s Needed
headline.print_headline: Making Sure Money’s Still There When It’s Needed
